atlantis.engine.graphics

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • atlantis.engine.graphics.BaseEntity
      • atlantis.engine.graphics.Sprite
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICollidable2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpriteGroup, SpriteText

    public class Sprite
extends BaseEntity
implements ICollidable2
    A sprite is a graphical object which can be a simple image or a more complex animated entity.
    Author:
    Yannick

      • postUpdate

        protected void postUpdate()
        Called when the update process is done and before the draw method. Some operations are done in this method such as position, direction updates and collides detection.

      • prepareAnimation

        public void prepareAnimation(int width,
                    int height)
        Initialize the first step of the animation process. You must call this method before add any animation.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of an animation (Can be recomputed later).
        height - The height of an animation (Can be recomputed later).

      • addAnimation

        public void addAnimation(java.lang.String name,
                int[] framesIndex,
                int frameRate)
        Add an animation which is a set of frame index on the sprite sheet.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the animation.
        framesIndex - An array of index.
        frameRate - The desired frame rate for this animation.

      • play

        public void play(java.lang.String name)
        Play an animation by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the animation to play.

      • setViewport

        public void setViewport(int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
        Determine the viewport of the sprite.
        Parameters:
        x - Start position on X.
        y - Start position on Y.
        width - Width
        height - Height

      • setAcceleration

        public void setAcceleration(Vector2 acceleration)
        Sets the acceleration. Be carefull because if this value is setted to (0, 0) the sprite will have its position to (0, 0) all the time.
        Parameters:
        acceleration - Value of acceleration.

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(Vector2 velocity)
        Sets the max velocity. The less the value is lower, the more the velocity effect affect the sprite.
        Parameters:
        maxVelocity - A vector for X and Y axis.

      • setMaxVelocity

        public void setMaxVelocity(float maxVelocity)
        Sets the max velocity. The less the value is lower, the more the velocity effect affect the sprite.
        Parameters:
        maxVelocity - A float number for X and Y axis.

      • forceInsideScreen

        public void forceInsideScreen(boolean insideScreen)
        Force the sprite to stay inside its viewport.
        Parameters:
        insideScreen - Sets to true to force.

      • allowAcrossScreen

        public void allowAcrossScreen(boolean acrossScreen)
        Allow the sprite across the screen.
        Parameters:
        acrossScreen - Sets to true to enable.
